The following is a representative barcode sequence, the centroid of all available sequences for this species.


There are 138 barcode sequences available from BOLD and GenBank.

Below is a sequence of the barcode region Cytochrome oxidase subunit 1 (COI or COX1) from a member of the species.

See the BOLD taxonomy browser for more complete information about this specimen and other sequences.

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: De Grave, S., Page, T. & Ayhong, S. 2013. Paratya australiensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
De Grave, S., Page, T. & Ayhong, S.

Reviewer/s
Cumberlidge, N. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
Paratya australiensis is widespread in coastal areas along the eastern seaboard of Australia, distributed in Queensland, New South Wales, Victoria and Tasmania (Davie 2002), where it is abundant in numerous locations. No specific threats were identified to this species, nor its environment and thus the species is considered as Least Concern.
